A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: Overall\, the originality of the movie over The Force Awakens was a winning move for me. I didn’t enjoy the paths taken for Finn and Rey and it felt like a missed opportunity - Finn became a fully-throwaway side character\, and Rey’s personality is never developed. Rey needed a few monologues of her own - often the movie was just happening around her and it was just assumed how she would respond without knowing what she was really thinking- a blanket hero is boring. The cinematography\, and the bravery of the plot were both elite though\, and trump some of the other choices. The movies has to please a young audience as well as old\, and for a director to juggle that requires some compromise in tone and focus. Rian Johnson had a much bigger challenge to succeed in that task because he was shocking the audience more with plot twists compared to TFA\, which had taken The New Hope’s frame and re-wrote it for a new protagonist (Rey instead of Luke). To get 5 stars however\, to recap\, I needed to hear from Rey more about her inner monologue of thoughts so that I would care more about her journey.
